senses.sense_definition: A defensive trench or earthwork constructed outward from a fortification to intercept or hinder the advance of besieging forces.

examples.text: The general ordered the immediate construction of a <w>counterapproach</w> to disrupt the enemy's progress toward the citadel walls.
Military engineers designed a complex <w>counterapproach</w> to intercept the besiegers before they could undermine the main gate.
